basic.floral_language:
Hosta venusta 
Floriography: tranquil, temperate, pure.
The plant grows delicately upright. Leaves are round heart shaped with gloss. Flowers are produced on erect scapes. The individual flowers are usually pendulous with six petals, white, lavender, or violet in color and strongly fragrant. Garden uses are for pots, flower beds, borders and around ponds.
Grows best in shade with good ventilation under scatter light. Blooms in July to September for one to two weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period July-September, viewing period 1-2 weeks
basic.color: Leaf color green , flower color white or light purple

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes shade, can put in places with bright scattered light
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry, may spray water on the leaves in summer, water less frequently in winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased, dead leaves and withered flowers timely
